Package rules

Class Rule

java.lang.Object
rules.Rule
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Allows user to create a rule with multiple thresholds
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Rule.comparator
    User can only select the options bellow as comparators for the Rules "Select" is used in GUI class as default
    static class  Rule.operator
    User can only select OR and AND as operators for the Rules

  • Constructor Details

    • Rule

      public Rule​(java.lang.String ruleName, int ruleType, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> metricName, java.util.ArrayList<Rule.comparator> comp, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> limits, java.util.ArrayList<Rule.operator> oper) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Allows user to create a rule with multiple thresholds
      Parameters:
      ruleName - the name of the rule
      ruleType - the type of rule created
      metricName - the array with the metric names to be calculated
      comp - the array with the comparators
      limits - the array with the limits defined by the user
      oper - the array with the operators
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file imported isn't found

  • Method Details

    • getThresholds

      public java.util.ArrayList<Threshold> getThresholds()
      Getter for the array of the Thresholds
      Returns:
      arrayList with all the Thresholds of the rule

    • createThresholds

      public void createThresholds() throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      creates the Thresholds and adds them to the Rule
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file imported isn't found

    • calculateThresholds

      public void calculateThresholds​(java.util.ArrayList<Resultado> result, java.util.ArrayList<BoolResultado> boolresult) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Gets the results of the calculated Thresholds and inserts the result in a boolResult array
      Parameters:
      result - the array with the results of all the calculated thresholds of the Rule
      boolresult - the array with the boolean result of the calculated thresholds of the Rule
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file imported isn't found

    • logic1

      public boolean logic1​(Threshold t, int valor) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      calculates the logic of a threshold
      Parameters:
      t - the threshold to be calculated
      valor - the limit of the respective threshold
      Returns:
      the boolean result of the calculated threshold
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file imported isn't found

    • logic2

      public boolean logic2​(Threshold t, Threshold t1, int valor, int valor1) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      calculates the logic between two thresholds
      Parameters:
      t - the thresholds to be calculated
      t1 - the thresholds to be calculated
      valor - the limits of the respective thresholds
      valor1 - the limits of the respective thresholds
      Returns:
      the boolean logic between the thresholds using the operator selected
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file imported isn't found

    • logic3

      public boolean logic3​(Threshold t1, Threshold t2, Threshold t3, int valor1, int valor2, int valor3) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      calculates the logic between three thresholds
      Parameters:
      t1 - the thresholds to be calculated
      t2 - the thresholds to be calculated
      t3 - the thresholds to be calculated
      valor1 - the limits of the respective thresholds
      valor2 - the limits of the respective thresholds
      valor3 - the limits of the respective thresholds
      Returns:
      the boolean logic between the thresholds using the operators selected
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file imported isn't found

    • and

      public boolean and​(boolean one, boolean two)
      calculates the thresholds if the operator choosen is AND
      Parameters:
      one - the result of the first threshold calculated
      two - the result of the second threshold calculated
      Returns:
      the result of a AND logic between two booleans

    • or

      public boolean or​(boolean one, boolean two)
      calculates the thresholds if the operator choosen is OR
      Parameters:
      one - the result of the first threshold calculated
      two - the result of the second threshold calculated
      Returns:
      the result of a OR logic between two booleans

    • check

      public void check()
      Checks if the Rule is created correctly, with all arrays in the desired size to be calculated
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the user tries to create a rule with unwanted sizes of the arrays

      Getter for the array of the metric names
      Returns:
      arrayList with all metric names in the rule

    • getOper

      public java.util.ArrayList<Rule.operator> getOper()
      Getter for the array of the Operators
      Returns:
      arrayList with all the operators of the rule

    • setRuleName

      public void setRuleName​(java.lang.String ruleName)
      Set's a name for the rule created
      Parameters:
      ruleName - a String chosen by the user to name the Rule created

    • setLimits

      public void setLimits​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> limits)
      Set's a array of limits for the rule created
      Parameters:
      limits - gets the array of limits chosen by the user to calculate the thresholds of the Rule created

    • setThresholds

      public void setThresholds​(java.util.ArrayList<Threshold> thresholds)
      Set's a array of thresholds for the rule created
      Parameters:
      thresholds - gets the array of thresholds created by the user to insert in the Rule created
